On Wed, Sep 28, 2011 at 1:51 PM, Erik Mogensen <erik@...> wrote:

> **
>
>> I'm looking for a Java library which can evaluate a URI against a given
>> URI template. What would you recommend? Basically I need to check whether a
>> URI, matches with a given URI template and extract the variable values etc.
>>
>> Please be aware that the URI template specification has been written with
> the opposite process in mind: The draft describes "the process
> for expanding a URI Template into a URI reference."
>
> This may cause you problems like the need for disambiguation, since a
> single URI may match several templates, with no way of knowing which
> template was used to create the URI in question.
>

Agreed but if you provide a set of templates and a concrete URI then you can
use unification to find the best match (maybe with some basic conflict
resolution - such as take the longest match). We want to use URI templates
for both directions .. for matching (and then routing) and of course for
minting URIs.

Sanjiva.
--
